label: ZW075
info_overview:
Smart Energy Switch 3rd Edition

  • Remotely turn connected device on/off to save electricity
  • Reports wattage consumption or kwh energy usage
  • Small size to help minimize blocking of other AC outlets
info_inclusion: Put your controller into inclusion mode. Press the Action Button on your switch. If your switch has been successfully linked to your network, its LED will no longer blink. If the linking was unsuccessful the LED will continue to blink.
info_exclusion: Put your controller into exclusion mode. Press the Action Button on your switch. If your switch has been successfully removed from your network, its LED will blink. If the removal was unsuccessful its LED will not blink.
category_description: Small devices to be plugged into a power socket in a wall which stick there

parameters.label: Blinking Behaviour
parameters.description: The LSB defines the total time the device need to blink.
parameters.overview: The LSB defines the total time the device need to blink. The value if set in seconds. 1 - 255 The MSB defines the on/off interval of the blinking. The unit is 0.1 s. This is a double byte value.

parameters.label: Current Overload Protection
parameters.description: Load will be closed when the Current over runs
parameters.overview: Load will be closed when the Current over runs (US: 15.5A, other country: 16.2A) for more than 2 minutes.

parameters.label: Output Load Status
parameters.description: Configure the output load status after re‐power on.

parameters.label: Notification on Status Change
parameters.description: Enable device to send notification to associated devices
parameters.overview: Enable device to send notification to associated devices (Group 1) when the state of Micro Smart Switch's load changed. DEFAULT is Disable

parameters.label: Configure the state of red LED
parameters.description: Enable the device to send notification to associated devices (Group 1)
parameters.overview: Enable the device to send notification to associated devices (Group 1) when the state of the Micro Smart Switch's load changed

options.label: The LED will follow the status of its load

parameters.label: Enables/disables parameter 91/92
parameters.description: Enable/Disable automated sending of report triggered by minimal change of value.
parameters.overview: Users, who want a more constant monitoring of power consumption should set this value to 1. The reporting period is by default quite long ( approx. 35minutes)

parameters.label: Minimum Change to send Report (Watt)
parameters.description: The value represents the minimum change in Wattage for a Report to be sent.

parameters.label: Minimum Change to send Report (%)
parameters.description: Minimum change in Wattage Percent for a report to be sent.
parameters.overview: The value represents the minimum change in Wattage Percent for a report to be sent. Range is 0 to 100%

parameters.label: Set 101‐103 to default
parameters.description: Enable/Disable automated report triggered by min. change of value.
parameters.overview: Enable/Disable automated sending of report triggered by minimal change of value.

parameters.label: Report type to send to Group 1
parameters.description: The value is a combination number
parameters.overview:
The value is a combination number made up of the sum of the values for the individual parameters.

The parameters have the values: KWH=8, Wattage=4, Current=2, Voltage=1.

Therefore if you want all parameters sending regular r

parameters.label: Report type to send to Group 2
parameters.description: The value is a combination number
parameters.overview:
The value is a combination number made up of the sum of the values for the individual parameters.

The parameters have the values: KWH=8, Wattage=4, Current=2, Voltage=1.

 Therefore if you want all parameters sending regular re

parameters.label: Report type to send to Group 3
parameters.description: The value is a combination number
parameters.overview: The value is a combination number <br> made up of the sum of the values for the individual parameters. <br> The parameters have the values: KWH=8, Wattage=4, Current=2, Voltage=1. <br> Therefore if you want all parameters sending regular re

parameters.label: Interval to send out reports to Group 1
parameters.description: Time Interval to send reports to Group 1
parameters.overview:
Defines the time interval when the defined report of Reporting Group 1 is sent out.

0 s - 65535 s - Interval

parameters.label: Interval to send out reports of group 2
parameters.description: Time interval to send reports of group 2
parameters.overview:
Defines the time interval when the defined report of Reporting Group 2 is sent out.

0 s - 65535 s - Interval

parameters.label: Interval to send out reports of group 3
parameters.description: Time interval when report of Reporting Group 3 is sent.
parameters.overview:
Defines the time interval when the defined report of Reporting Group 3 is sent out.

0 s - 65535 s - Interval
